description: A scientific tool used to identify and classify water pollution problems. An Index of Biotic Integrity (IBI) associates anthropogenic influences on a water body with biological activity in the water body, and is formulated using data developed from biosurveys.[Karr, J. R. (1981), Assessment of Biotic Integrity Using Fish Communities. Fisheries, 6: 21-27. doi:10.1577/1548-8446(1981)006<0021:AOBIUF>2.0.CO;2]
title: Index Of Biotic Integrity
